text: Faith is precisely this paradox, that the single individual is higher than the universal. It is not that he remains within the universal, but that he goes beyond it. If this is not faith, then Abraham is lost, then faith has never existed in the world... precisely because it is absurd. The Knight of Faith is the only happy man, the heir apparent to the finite, while the Knight of Resignation is a stranger and an alien. To have faith is to lose one's mind in order to win God.

The despair that is conscious of being despair.
If one is to define this condition more exactly, one must say: it is a despair that is conscious of being a deed, of being an act of the will...
The self is a relation that relates itself to itself or is the relation's relating itself to itself in the relation; the self is not the relation but that the relation relates itself to itself. Man is a synthesis of the infinite and the finite, of the temporal and the eternal, of freedom and necessity, in short, a synthesis. A synthesis is a relation between two. Considered in this way, man is still not a self.
